intro: Physodia physodes, commonly known as the showy physodes, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are often branched and covered in fine pubescence. Physodia physodes produces small, berry-like fruits that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans.
